questions.label: Complementary food from 6 months: Other foods introduced

alert.message: A baby who is exclusively breastfed may pass stool many times or may not pass any for some days. This is normal unless he/she has abdominal distension or is vomiting.

sections.label: Other problems as reported by parent/guardian

questions.label: Does the baby have problems sleeping?

answers.label: Follows a colourful object dangled before their eyes (0-2 months)
Turns the head, rolls over, responds to sound and smiles when you speak ((2 - 4 months )
Reaches for and grasps objects with hand (4 - 6 months)
Moves object from one hand to the other (6 - 9 months)
Imitates simple gestures (claps hands, bye) (9 - 12 months)
Points to some body parts on request (12 - 18 months)
Points at pictures on request (18 - 24 months)
Turns door knobs and lids (24 -30 months)
Can name some body parts (24 -30 months)
Knows if he or she is a boy or a girl (24 -30 months)
Plays next to and with other children (30-36 months)
Able to take off some clothes by self (30-36 months)
Speech is understood by family and friends (30-36 months)
Says first name, when asked (36-48 months)
Draws a circle, when shown (36-48 months)
Puts on some clothes by him/herself (36-48 months)
Names a few colors of items (4-5 years)
Draws a person with 3 or more body parts (4-5 years)
Follows rules or takes turns when playing games with other children (5 years and older)
Does simple chores at home (5 years and older)

answers.label: Birth less than 2 years after last birth
Birth order Fifth or more child
Born of a mentally ill mother
Any of the child's sibling been undernourished
